item.description: week 1 t1 Humans of New York t2 Reading to learn art of expression t3 Let him go, Olivia Bilibili - week1-开课准备

He makes me want to know about little things, so that I can teach him. Like when we sit by this lake, I wish I knew what kind of turtle that was, so I could tell him. And I want to finger out what kind of duck that is, so I can tell him about it next time we come. What do you want most for him ? Whatever his dreams are, I’m down to ride for him.

Reading to Learn the Art of Expression When you read a short story, you may read it merely for pleasure. When you read a biographical sketch, you may read it merely for information. But as you are a learner of English, I think you should often read to learn the art of expression. And for this purpose you may read either a short story or a biographical sketch, either an essay or a news item, indeed, anything that is written in good current English.

Let Him Go, Olivia Alejandro Arbide, San Antonio, Texas. There I was. Upside down inside the swimming pool. Drowned. My parents were screaming. It must have been the summer of ‘63. It was a gloomy day. Every Sunday we went to my grandparents’ house. My cousins and I were playing alongside the pool. I must have slipped. At three years old, I did not know how to swim. My mother was giving me CPR.

形容词 then 用法详解 核心概念 这里的 then 不是副词“然后”，而是形容词“当时的”。 原句分析 原短语： then recently discovered CPR 字面意思： “在当时那个时间点，新近被发现的心肺复苏术” 结构： then（形容词） + recently discovered（复合形容词） + CPR（名词） 语法功能 时间锚定作用 then 将“新发现”的时间锁定在故事发生的过去时刻，而不是作者写作的现在时刻。 双重时间限定 recently discovered：相对于某个时间点“最近” then：明确指出这个时间点是故事中的1963年 拆解理解 Without then: 新近发现的CPR（可能指现在的新发现） With then: 在当时（1963年） 算是新近发现的CPR 同义转换 …utilizing CPR, which was, at that time, a recently discovered technique.

item.description: Bilibili 1. 2. 课后日常作业： “Westen Civilization” 读 2-3 遍。尝试自己阅读 第三章。 每天读一个自然段。 key noets notes. 读英文原版书。 pretask: 预习 - 学习 - 练习 - 总结 -> 预习… 课前学习/预习， 整理自己痛点， 专注学习目标。 相信老师， 使用 老师提供的方法学习。 信任老师 是想他学习的基本前提。 学习 英语能力 ， 非 考试能力 。 自己写作业 - 自己修改
